intro: Lophiolepis rigida, commonly known as the rigid lophiolepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lophiolepis rigida is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
